intro: Schwenckia breviseta, commonly known as the short-stemmed schwenckia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellow flowers with five petals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture. Schwenckia breviseta is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
